then we will never escape the 2 party system.
 
 Some people say that voting for a candidate they agree with or believe in constitutes throwing your vote away if the candidate is not an elephant or a donkey. This is absurd.
 
 If everyone believes this, then we will never excape the 2 party system. 
 
 So please, stop saying that. It's not true. One day, one or more of these other parties will gain popularity and support. Hopefully they will not become the arm of corporate interests that the 2 main parties have been for quite some time now. 
 
 .

post_info.post_title: If voting for third parties is throwing away your vote...

I feel we just need to implement instant-runoff voting, and that will help a GREAT deal in helping to get third parties elected.

Ok, fine, I agree we need to change to instant run-off voting, but how am I incorrect? You would still vote (primarily) for the candidate that you felt represented you.
 
 .
no, campain finance reform will help, right now the elections are being bought.

Oh, of course. It makes you wonder how much reform McCain and Feingold actually had in mind. The law does a lot of good, but one side effect was the imfamous 527s. 
 
 What about the prospect of a public election fund that's actually public?
 
 
 .

then we will never escape the 2 party system.
 
 Some people say that voting for a candidate they agree with or believe in constitutes throwing your vote away if the candidate is not an elephant or a donkey. This is absurd.
 
 If everyone believes this, then we will never excape the 2 party system. 
 
 So please, stop saying that. It's not true. One day, one or more of these other parties will gain popularity and support. Hopefully they will not become the arm of corporate interests that the 2 main parties have been for quite some time now. 
 
 .

 
 I don't think it can change.
 
 How would two controlling parties (Dem/Rep) ever, ever, ever, choose to allow a third party to gain more than a tiny bit of support? It's not in their best interest. They have a 50/50 chance of winning when there are two parties. If a third comes into the play, it's 33/33/33 (all things equal). The two parties work TOGETHER to screw the third, every, single, time. It, IMO, CANNOT happen unless it was mandated by law. And as I said in another post, how can one expect that to happen when the law makers are all one of the two parties in power? 
 
 Third parties at best will show Dems/Repubs what issues are bubbling to the top, and hopefully they will latch onto a few, now and then.
 
 -Mach

I feel we just need to implement instant-runoff voting, and that will help a GREAT deal in helping to get third parties elected.

 
 That, and proportional representation.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  If voting for third parties is throwing away your vote...
